comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content:
Why are Republicans in Congress trying to end the U.S. Postal Servive?  First they passed a stupid law during a lame duck session in 2006 to force the Postal Service to pay $5.5 billion dollars toward their retirement account.  No other agency or company has ever been forced to do so.  The post office was making money before that time.  Since then, they have been in the red.  The US Postal Service is called for in Article One of the US Constitution.  Republicans claim they live by the Constitution.  Why are they trying to privatize everything?  Why are they trying to end their own government?  They collect a nice paycheck from the government/U.S. taxpayers.

This photo, btw, is circa 1940.

comment.author: 29019652@N00
comment._content: It's a wonderful image, but it sure wasn't taken in 1955, as several have suggested above.  The idea that it's a funeral procession makes good sense to me, and I say Amen to budderflyman's comment!

comment.author: 53521560@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rlovetaylor] I agree with you Bob, this is no later than 1933. I guess it's somewhere during the Alcohol Prohibition (1920-'33).. let's say 1929. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/21686909@N07] And, Michael, to answer your (rhetoric) question: Why are they trying to privatize everything? I'd say: because they believe in the wild dreams of that unguided projectile Ayn Rand.. and! because there is no Red Thread to keep them in trail.

comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content:
It's not a funeral procession because the headlights are not turned on, but it could be a salute to a dead postal worker.  The reason I say this photo is around 1940 is based on the last auto you see on the left of the photo.  That is at least 1940, maybe a bit later.  I can also tell just by the clothing this is not 1933 or before.  And now that I think about it, I wonder if this was a patriotic parade right after the Pearl Harbor attack....that would make sense with the snow and the flags on the trucks.

Yeah, they are all hung up with Ayn Rand, but 99% of them don't even know she was an atheist and that, I would think, would cause them to call her a commie.  LOL

comment.author: 53521560@N04
comment._content:
Up to that: she came in from The Cold.. :O

..and about the date of the photo, we did see such old-style cars not even during the war. This is a pre-war image to me; but what do I know, as a far away European. ;)

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Thank you for all your comments about the date of the photograph. The curator at the National Postal Museum agrees that it is earlier than previously believed. We have changed the date to reflect that.
